title: Problems With Paywalls
summary:
Key ideas
- Paywalls on articles are a standard pro-business argument.
- Clickbait articles create new preferences in readers.
- Paywalls make it hard for readers to access articles, and difficult for search engines to provide useful results.
- Steps can be taken to fix this issue.

Key learnings
- The business argument for paywalls is not true in all cases.
- Clickbait articles are designed to create new desires in readers and are not necessarily informative.
- Paywalls create a smaller and less diverse discussion section.
- There are steps that we can take to improve access to information.

Key questions
- Why do paywalled newspapers use a clickbait model?
- How can we prevent the clickbait model from ruling the internet?
- Why do newspapers make it hard to guess whether articles are paywalled or not?
- What are the consequences of having a smaller and less diverse discussion section?
